dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, so Kazakhstanis, uh, working a five-day workweek... will get eight days off in April? That's it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, so Kazakhstanis, uh, working a five-day workweek... will get eight days off in April? That's it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazakhstanis working a five-day workweek will get 8 days off in April.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, well, I mean, the article says there are no state or national holidays in the fourth month of 2025. So, like, that's, um, just the weekends.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, well, I mean, the article says there are no state or national holidays in the fourth month of twenty twenty five. So, like, that's, um, just the weekends.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: There are no state or national holidays in the fourth month of 2025.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: No state holidays? But it lists, like, a bunch of international and professional holidays, Host_B!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No state holidays? But it lists, like, a bunch of international and professional holidays, Host_B!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Those aren't days off, though. It, uh, specifies, "although not days off, may be of interest."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Those aren't days off, though. It, uh, specifies, although not days off, may be of interest.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Several international and professional holidays are celebrated in April, which, although not days off, may be of interest:

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: World Health Day? April 7th? Why wouldn't that be a day off? Like, shouldn't everyone be resting to be healthy?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: World Health Day? April seventh? Why wouldn't that be a day off? Like, shouldn't everyone be resting to be healthy?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's, um, intended to remind us of the importance of maintaining physical and mental well-being, not to give us a day off from it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's, um, intended to remind us of the importance of maintaining physical and mental well-being, not to give us a day off from it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It has been celebrated annually since 1950 and reminds us of the importance of maintaining physical and mental well-being.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And this campaign, "Healthy beginnings, hopeful futures"—what even is that, uh, really achieving on a workday?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And this campaign, Healthy beginnings, hopeful futures-what even is that, uh, really achieving on a workday?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This year, the campaign, entitled "Healthy beginnings, hopeful futures," calls on governments and the global community to" to ramp up efforts to end preventable maternal and newborn deaths, and to prioritize women™s longer-term health and well-being."

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It calls on governments, like, to ramp up efforts to end preventable maternal and newborn deaths.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It calls on governments, like, to ramp up efforts to end preventable maternal and newborn deaths.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This year, the campaign, entitled "Healthy beginnings, hopeful futures," calls on governments and the global community to" to ramp up efforts to end preventable maternal and newborn deaths, and to prioritize women™s longer-term health and well-being."

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, basically, they're just, uh, working harder on World Health Day to fix problems. That's, uh, that's rich.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, basically, they're just, uh, working harder on World Health Day to fix problems. That's, uh, that's rich.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, yeah, it seems like a, uh, working day reminder.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, yeah, it seems like a, uh, working day reminder.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And get this, Host_B, Valentine's Day in Kazakhstan is on April 15th! That's, like, not even close to February!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And get this, Host_B, Valentine's Day in Kazakhstan is on April fifteenth! That's, like, not even close to February!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: April 15 is Valentine's Day in Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's, uh, dedicated to the love of two heroes of the poem "Kozy Korpesh and Bayan-Sulu." A different, um, tradition.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's, uh, dedicated to the love of two heroes of the poem Kozy Korpesh and Bayan-Sulu. A different, um, tradition.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The holiday is dedicated to the great love of two heroes of the poem "Kozy Korpesh and Bayan-Sulu."

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So they just, like, made up their own Valentine's Day, conveniently, uh, in April? How original.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So they just, like, made up their own Valentine's Day, conveniently, uh, in April? How original.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's based on, um, their own cultural story, I guess.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's based on, um, their own cultural story, I guess.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And after all these so-called "holidays" that aren't days off, you still only get eight days off in April? That's, uh, that's just the normal weekends.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And after all these so-called holidays that aren't days off, you still only get eight days off in April? That's, uh, that's just the normal weekends.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: With a five-day workweek, April has 22 working days and 8 days off.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: For a five-day workweek, yeah. If you're on a six-day workweek, it's, um, only four days off.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For a five-day workweek, yeah. If you're on a six-day workweek, it's, um, only four days off.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In April 2025, with a six-day workweek, there will be 26 working days and 4 days off.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Four days off? That's, uh, that's just Sundays. Incredible. What a, um, calendar.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Four days off? That's, uh, that's just Sundays. Incredible. What a, um, calendar.
